item.title: 投资者为中东战争引发的更大反弹做准备
item.description: 中东冲突已从边缘风险演变为投资者最忧心的问题。伊朗政权更迭的可能引发的权力斗争以及地区战争的长期化前景令投资者不安，其影响将波及全球贸易乃至通胀等方方面面。【原文：From being just a fringe risk, conflict in the Middle East has become a top worry for investors unsettled by the prospect of a power struggle in Iran and a protracted regional war, with ramifications for everything from global trade to inflation.】

item.title: 投资者寻求黄金避风港，因美国和以色列对伊朗发动袭击
item.description: 美国和以色列对伊朗的打击加剧了全球市场的动荡，投资者正密切关注可能涌入黄金市场的避险资金。以下是投资者、交易员和分析师的反应：【原文：The U.S. and Israeli strikes on Iran have intensified uncertainty across global markets, with investors closely watching potential safe-haven flows into bullion. Here is some reaction from investors, traders and analysts:】

item.title: 分析师称，受伊朗冲突影响，油价飙升10%，可能飙升至每桶100美元。
item.description: 在德黑兰警告船只勿通过霍尔木兹海峡后，多数油轮船东、大型石油公司及贸易公司已暂停经该水道运输原油、燃料及液化天然气的业务。【原文：Most tanker owners, big oil companies and trading houses suspended crude oil, fuel and liquefied natural gas shipments via the Strait of Hormuz after Tehran warned ships against moving through the waterway.】

item.title: 比亚迪2月汽车销量跌幅创疫情以来最大
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪上月全球销量创下六年最大跌幅。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD recorded the biggest fall in global sales in six years last month.】

item.title: 欧佩克+讨论增产石油，因美国对伊朗的战争扰乱了石油运输
item.description: 两名欧佩克+消息人士称，该组织将于周日考虑实施超出预期的增产计划。此前，美国与以色列对欧佩克+成员国伊朗发动军事行动，德黑兰随即采取报复措施，导致中东地区石油运输中断。【原文：OPEC+ will consider a larger-than-expected oil output increase on Sunday, two OPEC+ sources said after the U.S.-Israeli war on OPEC+ member Iran and Tehran's retaliation led to shipment disruptions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 目击者称，迪拜和多哈连续第二天听到爆炸声浪
item.description: 目击者称，周日迪拜和卡塔尔首都多哈连续第二天传出巨大爆炸声。随着伊朗对美国和以色列袭击伊斯兰共和国的报复性打击范围扩大，伊朗对邻近海湾国家的反击行动也在持续。【原文：Loud blasts were heard in Dubai and the Qatari capital Doha for the second day on Sunday, witnesses said, as Iran's retaliatory strikes on neighbouring Gulf states in response to U.S. and Israeli strikes on the Islamic Republic widened.】

item.title: 小米表示，2月份电动汽车交付量突破2万辆，较1月份有所下降。
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商小米周日通过其官方微博账号发布消息称，2月份交付量超过2万辆，较1月份的3.9万余辆有所下降。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker Xiaomi said it delivered more than 20,000 vehicles in February, down from more than 39,000 in January, according to a post on its official Weibo account on Sunday.】

item.title: 韩国2月出口超预期，连续第九个月增长
item.description: 韩国出口在2月份延续了连续九个月的增长势头，强劲的芯片销售持续支撑着整体出货量，尽管美国关税的不确定性给前景蒙上阴影。【原文：South Korea's exports extended their growth streak to a ninth month in February as strong chip sales continued to underpin overall shipments even as uncertainties regarding U.S. tariffs cloud the outlook.】

item.title: OpenAI详述与美国国防部协议中的分层保护机制
item.description: OpenAI周六表示，其前日与五角大楼达成的协议包含额外保障措施，以保护该技术在美国国防部机密网络中的应用场景。【原文：OpenAI said on Saturday that the agreement it struck a day ago with the Pentagon to deploy technology on the U.S. defense department's classified network includes additional safeguards to protect its use cases.】

item.title: 伯克希尔首席执行官阿贝尔在接替巴菲特后，力图安抚股东
item.description: 伯克希尔·哈撒韦公司新任首席执行官格雷格·阿贝尔于周六发表其首封致股东年度信函，试图为这家综合企业集团打上个人烙印。他在信中承诺将维持公司"堡垒般的"资产负债表，并恪守其前任兼导师沃伦·巴菲特的价值观。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway's new Chief Executive Greg Abel moved to put his stamp on the conglomerate with his first annual letter to shareholders on Saturday, pledging to maintain its "fortress-like" balance sheet and uphold the values of his predecessor and mentor, Warren Buffett.】

item.title: 据消息人士称，随着美国对伊朗发动袭击，石油和天然气巨头及贸易商已暂停经霍尔木兹海峡的运输。
item.description: 多家油轮船东、石油巨头和贸易公司已暂停经霍尔木兹海峡运输原油、燃料及液化天然气的业务。此前美国和以色列对伊朗发动袭击，德黑兰方面宣布关闭该海峡航道。贸易消息人士周六透露了这一情况。【原文：Several tanker owners, oil majors and trading houses have suspended crude oil, fuel and liquefied natural gas shipments via the Strait of Hormuz after the U.S. and Israel attacked Iran and Tehran said it had closed navigation, trading sources said on Saturday.】

item.title: 市场分析师对美以对伊朗的打击行动作出反应
item.description: 美国和以色列周六对伊朗发动空袭，目标锁定其领导层，使中东陷入新一轮冲突。美国总统特朗普表示，此举将消除安全威胁，并为伊朗人民推翻统治者创造机会。【原文：The United States and Israel launched strikes on Iran on Saturday, targeting its leadership and plunging the Middle East into a new conflict that President Donald Trump said would end a security threat and give Iranians a chance to topple their rulers.】

item.title: 美伊紧张局势如何影响全球市场
item.description: 美国和以色列周六对伊朗发动空袭，打击其领导层，使中东陷入新一轮冲突。美国总统特朗普表示，此举将消除安全威胁，并让伊朗人民获得推翻统治者的机会。【原文：The United States and Israel launched strikes on Iran on Saturday, targeting its leadership and plunging the Middle East into a new conflict that President Donald Trump said would end a security threat and give Iranians a chance to topple their rulers.】

item.title: 伯克希尔·哈撒韦公司利润下滑，因资产减记及保险收入减少
item.description: 伯克希尔·哈撒韦公司周六表示，第四季度营业利润下滑，原因是该公司对卡夫亨氏和西方石油公司的投资进行了减记，同时其保险业务收入下降。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway on Saturday said operating profit fell in the fourth quarter, as it wrote down investments in Kraft Heinz and Occidental Petroleum while income from its insurance businesses declined.】

item.title: 智利锂矿商SQM第四季度利润激增53%
item.description: 智利锂生产商SQM周五公布，第四季度净利润实现增长，因更有利的定价环境推高了锂平均价格，从而提振了业绩。【原文：Chilean lithium producer SQM on Friday reported a rise in fourth-quarter net profit, as a stronger pricing environment lifted average lithium prices and boosted results.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，英伟达计划推出新型芯片以加速人工智能处理
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，知情人士透露，英伟达计划推出一款新型处理器，旨在帮助OpenAI及其他客户构建更快、更高效的人工智能系统。【原文：Nvidia plans to launch a new processor designed to help OpenAI and other customers build faster, more efficient AI systems, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: OpenAI达成协议，将在美国战争部机密网络上部署人工智能模型
item.description: OpenAI首席执行官山姆·阿尔特曼周五表示，该公司已与美国战争部达成协议，将在机密云网络上部署其人工智能模型。【原文：OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on Friday it has reached an agreement with the U.S. Department of War to deploy its AI models on classified cloud networks.】

item.title: Anthropic公司表示将就五角大楼对其供应链风险的认定提起诉讼
item.description: 安普瑞克公司周五表示，将就五角大楼将其列为供应链风险的决定提起诉讼。此前数小时，美国总统特朗普已指示所有联邦机构停止与该公司的合作。【原文：Anthropic said on Friday it will challenge in court the Pentagon's decision to declare the AI firm a supply-chain risk, hours after U.S. President Donald Trump also directed every federal agency to stop work with the company.】

item.title: 谁杀害了瑞典总理奥洛夫·帕尔梅？业余侦探向人工智能求助
item.description: 瑞典总理奥洛夫·帕尔梅在斯德哥尔摩街头遇刺身亡四十载，瑞典民众至今仍在思索：这起谋杀案究竟是独行刺客的所为，还是政治暗杀的阴谋？【原文：Forty years after Prime Minister Olof Palme was shot dead on a Stockholm street, Swedes are still wondering whether the murder was the work of a lone gunman or a political assassination.】

item.title: 多米尼加共和国拥有超过1.5亿吨的稀土矿藏，总统表示
item.description: 多米尼加共和国总统路易斯·阿比纳德尔周五表示，该国已探明稀土矿藏，这可能使这个加勒比国家成为未来高科技产业关键矿产的重要供应国。【原文：The Dominican Republic has identified rare earth deposits that could position the Caribbean nation as a significant future supplier of minerals critical to high-tech industries, President Luis Abinader said on Friday.】

item.title: 联邦快递客户在美国最高法院裁决后起诉公司要求退还关税
item.description: 联邦快递公司周五在联邦法院被起诉，多名客户要求这家全球运输企业退还运费。此前美国最高法院本月裁定，总统唐纳德·特朗普对进口商品征收数十亿美元紧急关税的行为违法。【原文：FedEx was sued in federal court on Friday on behalf of customers seeking refunds from the global shipping company after the U.S. Supreme Court ruled this month that President Donald Trump unlawfully imposed billions of dollars in emergency tariffs on imported goods.】

item.title: 法官叫停弗吉尼亚州限制儿童使用社交媒体的法律
item.description: 周五，一名联邦法官阻止弗吉尼亚州执行一项旨在保护儿童免受社交媒体成瘾影响的新法律。该法律要求进行年龄验证，并限制16岁以下人群每日使用时间不超过一小时。【原文：A federal judge on Friday blocked Virginia from enforcing a new law that aimed to protect children from being addicted to social media by requiring age verification and limiting use by those under 16 to one hour per day.】

item.title: 加拿大部长将与OpenAI首席执行官阿尔特曼会晤，讨论枪击事件后的安全措施
item.description: 加拿大人工智能事务部长周五表示，他将于下周会见OpenAI首席执行官山姆·阿尔特曼，讨论ChatGPT开发商在不列颠哥伦比亚省近期发生校园枪击事件后，如何加强安全协议。【原文：Canada's minister in charge of artificial intelligence said on Friday he will meet with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman next week to discuss how the ChatGPT maker plans to boost safety protocols after a recent school shooting in British Columbia.】

item.title: 达美航空追加订购34架空客A321neo客机，加速机队更新进程
item.description: 达美航空周五宣布，将再购入34架空客A321neo客机，作为其更新机队计划的一部分。该计划旨在引进燃油消耗更低且提供更多高端座位的机型。【原文：Delta Air Lines said on Friday it will buy 34 more Airbus A321neo jets as part of its plan to refresh its fleet with aircraft that burn less fuel and offer more premium seats.】

item.title: 派拉蒙以1100亿美元收购华纳兄弟探索公司；奈飞退出竞购
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司已同意以1100亿美元的价格被派拉蒙天空舞影业收购，这场高风险竞购战在奈飞退出与HBO Max母公司协议后落下帷幕。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery has agreed to be acquired by Paramount Skydance in a $110 billion deal, ending a high-stakes bidding war after Netflix walked away from its agreement with the HBO Max owner.】

item.title: 特朗普表示正指示联邦机构停止使用Anthropic技术
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周五表示，他已指示所有联邦机构立即停止使用Anthropic公司的技术，并补充说，对于使用该公司产品的机构（如国防部），将有六个月的过渡期。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he was directing every federal agency to immediately cease all use of Anthropic's technology, adding there would be a six-month phase out for agencies such as the Defense Department who use the company's products.】

item.title: 美国监管机构批准Charter通信公司以345亿美元收购Cox公司的交易
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周五宣布，已批准Charter通信公司以345亿美元收购Cox通信公司的交易。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission said Friday it approved Charter Communications’ $34.5 billion acquisition of Cox Communications.】

item.title: 彭博社称，SpaceX可能寻求超过1.75万亿美元的IPO估值
item.description: 据彭博社周五报道，知情人士透露，埃隆·马斯克旗下的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）正计划秘密提交首次公开募股申请，这可能使这家火箭和卫星公司的估值超过1.75万亿美元。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX is aiming to file confidentially for an initial public offering that could value the rocket and satellite company at more than $1.75 trillion, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴西部分撤销进口关税上调
item.description: 巴西政府周五宣布，将部分撤销今年早些时候批准的一项有争议的进口关税上调措施。【原文：Brazil's government partially rolled back a controversial increase in import tariffs approved earlier this year, the Ministry of Development, Industry, Trade and Services said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家：知情人士称，卡塔尔投资局、Visa和阿布扎比投资局将领衔软银旗下PayPay的首次公开募股
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，包括卡塔尔投资局旗下投资机构卡塔尔控股、Visa以及阿布扎比投资局在内的一批全球投资者，正准备作为基石投资者，向软银旗下PayPal在美国首次公开募股（IPO）中注资逾2亿美元。【原文：A group of global investors including Qatar Holdings, an investment arm of Qatar Investment Authority, Visa and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, is preparing to invest more than $200 million as cornerstone investors in the U.S. initial public offering by SoftBank's PayPay, according to two people familiar with the matter.】
